trans-unit.source: Enroll iOS devices with Setup Assistant | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Enroll iOS devices with Setup Assistant | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Enroll corporate-owned iOS devices using the Apple Configurator tool to factory-reset the device and prepares it to run the Setup Assistant.
trans-unit.target: Enroll corporate-owned iOS devices using the Apple Configurator tool to factory-reset the device and prepares it to run the Setup Assistant.

trans-unit.source: Enroll iOS devices with Apple Configurator using Setup Assistant
trans-unit.target: Enroll iOS devices with Apple Configurator using Setup Assistant

trans-unit.source: Intune supports the enrollment of corporate-owned iOS devices using the [Apple Configurator](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=518017) tool running on a Mac computer.
trans-unit.target: Intune supports the enrollment of corporate-owned iOS devices using the [Apple Configurator](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=518017) tool running on a Mac computer.

trans-unit.source: This process factory-resets the device and prepares it to run the Setup Assistant by the device’s new user with the company's policies preinstalled.
trans-unit.target: This process factory-resets the device and prepares it to run the Setup Assistant by the device’s new user with the company's policies preinstalled.

trans-unit.source: Setup Assistant enrollment for iOS devices with Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Setup Assistant enrollment for iOS devices with Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Using Apple Configurator you can factory reset iOS devices and prepares them for setup by the device’s new user.
trans-unit.target: Using Apple Configurator you can factory reset iOS devices and prepares them for setup by the device’s new user.

trans-unit.source: This method requires you to USB-connect the iOS device to a Mac computer to setup corporate enrollment and assumes you are using Apple Configurator 2.0.
trans-unit.target: This method requires you to USB-connect the iOS device to a Mac computer to setup corporate enrollment and assumes you are using Apple Configurator 2.0.

trans-unit.source: Most scenarios require that the policy applied to the iOS device include **user affinity** to enable the Intune Company Portal app.
trans-unit.target: Most scenarios require that the policy applied to the iOS device include **user affinity** to enable the Intune Company Portal app.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: [iOS enrollment enabled](set-up-ios-and-mac-management-with-microsoft-intune.md) by installing an APNs certificate
trans-unit.target: [iOS enrollment enabled](set-up-ios-and-mac-management-with-microsoft-intune.md) by installing an APNs certificate

trans-unit.source: Physical access to iOS devices - Devices must be unconfigured (factory reset) without password protection
trans-unit.target: Physical access to iOS devices - Devices must be unconfigured (factory reset) without password protection

trans-unit.source: Device serial numbers - [How to get an iOS serial number](https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT204308)
trans-unit.target: Device serial numbers - [How to get an iOS serial number](https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT204308)

trans-unit.source: USB connection cables
trans-unit.target: USB connection cables

trans-unit.source: Mac computer with [Apple Configurator 2.0](https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/apple-configurator-2/id1037126344?mt=12)
trans-unit.target: Mac computer with [Apple Configurator 2.0](https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/apple-configurator-2/id1037126344?mt=12)

trans-unit.source: **Create mobile device group** (Optional) If your business requires mobile device groups to help manage devices, create those groups.
trans-unit.target: **Create mobile device group** (Optional) If your business requires mobile device groups to help manage devices, create those groups.

trans-unit.source: [Use groups to manage users and devices with Microsoft Intune](use-groups-to-manage-users-and-devices-with-microsoft-intune.md).
trans-unit.target: [Use groups to manage users and devices with Microsoft Intune](use-groups-to-manage-users-and-devices-with-microsoft-intune.md).

trans-unit.source: **Create a profile for devices** A device enrollment profile defines the settings applied to a group of devices.
trans-unit.target: **Create a profile for devices** A device enrollment profile defines the settings applied to a group of devices.

trans-unit.source: If you have not already, create a device enrollment profile for iOS devices enrolled using Apple Configurator.
trans-unit.target: If you have not already, create a device enrollment profile for iOS devices enrolled using Apple Configurator.

trans-unit.source: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](http://manage.microsoft.com) go **Policy** > **Corporate Device Enrollment**, and then choose **Add…**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](http://manage.microsoft.com) go **Policy** > **Corporate Device Enrollment**, and then choose **Add…**.

trans-unit.source: Create device enrollment profile
trans-unit.target: Create device enrollment profile

trans-unit.source: Enter details for the device profiles:
trans-unit.target: Enter details for the device profiles:

trans-unit.source: **Name** – Name of the device enrollment profile.
trans-unit.target: **Name** – Name of the device enrollment profile.

trans-unit.source: (Not visible to users)
trans-unit.target: (Not visible to users)

trans-unit.source: **Description** - Description of the device enrollment profile.
trans-unit.target: **Description** - Description of the device enrollment profile.

trans-unit.source: (Not visible to users)
trans-unit.target: (Not visible to users)

trans-unit.source: **Enrollment Details** – Specifies how devices are enrolled.
trans-unit.target: **Enrollment Details** – Specifies how devices are enrolled.

trans-unit.source: **Prompt for user affinity** – The device must be affiliated with a user during initial setup and could then be permitted to access company data and email as that user.
trans-unit.target: **Prompt for user affinity** – The device must be affiliated with a user during initial setup and could then be permitted to access company data and email as that user.

trans-unit.source: **User affinity** should be configured for DEP-managed devices that belong to users and need to use the company portal (i.e. to install apps).
trans-unit.target: **User affinity** should be configured for DEP-managed devices that belong to users and need to use the company portal (i.e. to install apps).

trans-unit.source: **No user affinity** – The device is not affiliated with a user.
trans-unit.target: **No user affinity** – The device is not affiliated with a user.

trans-unit.source: Use this affiliation for devices that perform tasks without accessing local user data.
trans-unit.target: Use this affiliation for devices that perform tasks without accessing local user data.

trans-unit.source: Apps requiring user affiliation, including the Company Portal app used for installing line-of-business apps, won’t work.
trans-unit.target: Apps requiring user affiliation, including the Company Portal app used for installing line-of-business apps, won’t work.

trans-unit.source: **Device group pre-assignment** – All devices deployed this profile will initially belong to this group.
trans-unit.target: **Device group pre-assignment** – All devices deployed this profile will initially belong to this group.

trans-unit.source: You can reassign devices after enrollment.
trans-unit.target: You can reassign devices after enrollment.

trans-unit.source: **Device Enrollment Program** - The Apple Device Enrollment Program (DEP) cannot be used with Setup Assistant enrollment.
trans-unit.target: **Device Enrollment Program** - The Apple Device Enrollment Program (DEP) cannot be used with Setup Assistant enrollment.

trans-unit.source: Ensure the toggle is set to **off**.
trans-unit.target: Ensure the toggle is set to **off**.

trans-unit.source: Choose **Save Profile** to add the profile.
trans-unit.target: Choose **Save Profile** to add the profile.

trans-unit.source: **Add iOS devices to enroll with Setup Assistant** In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](http://manage.microsoft.com) go **Groups** > **All Devices** > **All Corporate-owned Devices** > **All Devices**, and then choose **Add devices…**.
trans-unit.target: **Add iOS devices to enroll with Setup Assistant** In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](http://manage.microsoft.com) go **Groups** > **All Devices** > **All Corporate-owned Devices** > **All Devices**, and then choose **Add devices…**.

trans-unit.source: You can add devices in two ways:
trans-unit.target: You can add devices in two ways:

trans-unit.source: Add devices dialog box
trans-unit.target: Add devices dialog box

trans-unit.source: **Upload a CSV file containing serial numbers** – Create a comma-separated value (.csv) list of two columns without a header, limited to 5000 devices or 5MB per csv file.
trans-unit.target: **Upload a CSV file containing serial numbers** – Create a comma-separated value (.csv) list of two columns without a header, limited to 5000 devices or 5MB per csv file.

trans-unit.source: Serial #1
trans-unit.target: Serial #1

trans-unit.source: Device #1 Details
trans-unit.target: Device #1 Details

trans-unit.source: Serial#2
trans-unit.target: Serial#2

trans-unit.source: Device #2 Details
trans-unit.target: Device #2 Details

trans-unit.source: This .csv file when viewed in a text editor appears as:
trans-unit.target: This .csv file when viewed in a text editor appears as:

trans-unit.source: **Manually add device details** - Enter the serial number and device details of up to five devices
trans-unit.target: **Manually add device details** - Enter the serial number and device details of up to five devices

trans-unit.source: If you must later remove corporate-owned devices from Intune management, you might need to remove the device serial number from Intune in the **By iOS Serial Number** device group under **Corporate Pre-enrolled devices** to disable device enrollment.
trans-unit.target: If you must later remove corporate-owned devices from Intune management, you might need to remove the device serial number from Intune in the **By iOS Serial Number** device group under **Corporate Pre-enrolled devices** to disable device enrollment.

trans-unit.source: If Intune performs a disaster recovery procedure on or around the time that serial numbers were removed, you will need to verify that only active devices’ serial numbers are present in that group.
trans-unit.target: If Intune performs a disaster recovery procedure on or around the time that serial numbers were removed, you will need to verify that only active devices’ serial numbers are present in that group.

trans-unit.source: Choose **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Choose **Next**.

trans-unit.source: **Select devices to enroll** Confirm the devices to enroll.
trans-unit.target: **Select devices to enroll** Confirm the devices to enroll.

trans-unit.source: Serial numbers already enrolled or enrolled by other means cannot be imported.
trans-unit.target: Serial numbers already enrolled or enrolled by other means cannot be imported.

trans-unit.source: Choose **Next** to continue.
trans-unit.target: Choose **Next** to continue.

trans-unit.source: **Assign profile** Specify the profile to assign to added devices from the list of available profiles, review the **Enrollment profile details**, and then choose **Finish**.
trans-unit.target: **Assign profile** Specify the profile to assign to added devices from the list of available profiles, review the **Enrollment profile details**, and then choose **Finish**.

trans-unit.source: Manually added devices can be assigned to any Enrollment profile.
trans-unit.target: Manually added devices can be assigned to any Enrollment profile.

trans-unit.source: **Export a profile to deploy to iOS devices** In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](http://manage.microsoft.com) go **Policy** > **Corporate Device Enrollment**, and then select the device profile to deploy to mobile devices.
trans-unit.target: **Export a profile to deploy to iOS devices** In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](http://manage.microsoft.com) go **Policy** > **Corporate Device Enrollment**, and then select the device profile to deploy to mobile devices.

trans-unit.source: Choose **Export…**
trans-unit.target: Choose **Export…**

trans-unit.source: in the taskbar.
trans-unit.target: in the taskbar.

trans-unit.source: Copy and save the **Profile URL**.
trans-unit.target: Copy and save the **Profile URL**.

trans-unit.source: You will upload it in Apple Configurator later to define the Intune profile used by iOS devices.
trans-unit.target: You will upload it in Apple Configurator later to define the Intune profile used by iOS devices.

trans-unit.source: To support Apple Configurator 2, the 2.0 Profile URL must be edited.
trans-unit.target: To support Apple Configurator 2, the 2.0 Profile URL must be edited.

trans-unit.source: Replace
trans-unit.target: Replace

trans-unit.source: with
trans-unit.target: with

trans-unit.source: You will upload this profile URL to the Apple DEP service using Apple Configurator in the following procedure to define the Intune profile used by iOS devices.
trans-unit.target: You will upload this profile URL to the Apple DEP service using Apple Configurator in the following procedure to define the Intune profile used by iOS devices.

trans-unit.source: **Prepare the device with Apple Configurator** iOS devices are connected to the Mac computer and enrolled for mobile device management.
trans-unit.target: **Prepare the device with Apple Configurator** iOS devices are connected to the Mac computer and enrolled for mobile device management.

trans-unit.source: On a Mac computer, open **Apple Configurator 2**.
trans-unit.target: On a Mac computer, open **Apple Configurator 2**.

trans-unit.source: In the menu bar, choose **Apple Configurator 2**, and then choose **Preferences**.
trans-unit.target: In the menu bar, choose **Apple Configurator 2**, and then choose **Preferences**.

trans-unit.source: The devices will be reset to factory configurations during the enrollment process.
trans-unit.target: The devices will be reset to factory configurations during the enrollment process.

trans-unit.source: As a best practice, reset the device and power it on.
trans-unit.target: As a best practice, reset the device and power it on.

trans-unit.source: As a best practice, devices should be at the **Hello** screen when you connect the device.
trans-unit.target: As a best practice, devices should be at the **Hello** screen when you connect the device.

trans-unit.source: In the preferences pane, select **Servers** and choose the “+” symbol below the left pane to launch the MDM Server wizard.
trans-unit.target: In the preferences pane, select **Servers** and choose the “+” symbol below the left pane to launch the MDM Server wizard.

trans-unit.source: Choose **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Choose **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Enter the **Name** and **Enrollment URL** for the MDM server from Step #6 above.
trans-unit.target: Enter the **Name** and **Enrollment URL** for the MDM server from Step #6 above.

trans-unit.source: For the Enrollment URL enter the enrollment profile URL exported from Intune.
trans-unit.target: For the Enrollment URL enter the enrollment profile URL exported from Intune.

trans-unit.source: Choose **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Choose **Next**.

trans-unit.source: If you receive a warning stating "server URL is not verified,"" you can safely disregard the warning.
trans-unit.target: If you receive a warning stating "server URL is not verified,"" you can safely disregard the warning.

trans-unit.source: To continue, choose **Next** until the wizard is complete.
trans-unit.target: To continue, choose **Next** until the wizard is complete.

trans-unit.source: Connect the iOS mobile devices to the Apple computer with a USB adapter.
trans-unit.target: Connect the iOS mobile devices to the Apple computer with a USB adapter.

trans-unit.source: The devices will be reset to factory configurations during the enrollment process.
trans-unit.target: The devices will be reset to factory configurations during the enrollment process.

trans-unit.source: As a best practice, reset the device and power it on.
trans-unit.target: As a best practice, reset the device and power it on.

trans-unit.source: As a best practice, devices should be at the **Hello** screen when you start Setup Assistant.
trans-unit.target: As a best practice, devices should be at the **Hello** screen when you start Setup Assistant.

trans-unit.source: Choose **Prepare**.
trans-unit.target: Choose **Prepare**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Prepare iOS Device** pane, select **Manual** and then choose **Next**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Prepare iOS Device** pane, select **Manual** and then choose **Next**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Enroll in MDM Server** pane, select the server name you created and then choose **Next**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Enroll in MDM Server** pane, select the server name you created and then choose **Next**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Supervise Devices** pane, select the level of supervision, and then choose **Next**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Supervise Devices** pane, select the level of supervision, and then choose **Next**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Create an Organization** pane, choose the **Organization** or create a new organization, and then choose **Next**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Create an Organization** pane, choose the **Organization** or create a new organization, and then choose **Next**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Configure iOS Setup Assistant** pane, choose the steps presented to the user, and then choose **Prepare**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Configure iOS Setup Assistant** pane, choose the steps presented to the user, and then choose **Prepare**.

trans-unit.source: If prompted, authenticate to update trust settings.
trans-unit.target: If prompted, authenticate to update trust settings.

trans-unit.source: When the iOS device finishes preparing, you can disconnect the USB cable.
trans-unit.target: When the iOS device finishes preparing, you can disconnect the USB cable.

trans-unit.source: **Distribute devices** The devices are now ready for corporate enrollment.
trans-unit.target: **Distribute devices** The devices are now ready for corporate enrollment.

trans-unit.source: Power down the devices and distribute them to users.
trans-unit.target: Power down the devices and distribute them to users.

trans-unit.source: When the device is turned on, the Setup Assistant will start.
trans-unit.target: When the device is turned on, the Setup Assistant will start.

trans-unit.source: See also
trans-unit.target: See also

trans-unit.source: Get ready to enroll devices
trans-unit.target: Get ready to enroll devices
